info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 2:59PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Fremont County through 330 PM MDT... At 258 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Guffey, or 28 miles northeast of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Fremont and southwestern Teller Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for central Colorado.
